reviewText:
This Windows XP Computer Help DVD can be watched on a regular television set or on a computer.

#3 in the 'PCs for the Computer Shy' series.

Despite the title, this DVD is the third instructional DVD in the 'PCs for the Computer Shy' series (after 'Computer Comfort' and 'Windows XP Basics - Part 1').

These computer help DVDs were designed and created for computer novices who want to learn how to use a computer in the comfort and privacy of their own living rooms.

Basic Windows XP operations are described and demonstrated including: how to Burn files to CDs; how to search online for software; how to back up your files to an external hard drive; and how to install virus protection software.

ADDITIONAL WINDOWS COMPUTER HELP DVDs

The first instructional DVD in this 'PCs for the Computer Shy' series is called: 'Computer Comfort'. The second DVD is called 'Windows XP Basics Part 1'. Both computer help videos are available from Amazon.com and CreateSpace.com.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Help for the Computer Shy founder Michael Gorzka has been teaching "computer shy" adults how to use personal computers (both Macs & PCs) and various software & Internet applications since 1997. He has incorporated what he has learned from his teaching experiences into his computer help DVDs and manuals."
